product_title: Cicaplast Balm B5+ Soothing Therapeutic Balm

overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Caregiver
overall_perception_summary.description: La Roche-Posay projects the ultimate 'Medical Authority'—a brand that functions as a sterile, reliable extension of the dermatologist's office. It strips away all lifestyle fluff to focus entirely on 'Therapeutic' intervention, positioning itself not as a beauty product but as a necessary tool for skin health and recovery. It feels like a prescription you can buy without a script.

foundation.title: The Medical Healer
foundation.description: The brand rejects aesthetic positioning to occupy the 'Pharmacy' slot (Medical Authority) completely. Its Purpose is purely 'Restorative'—fixing broken barriers rather than enhancing glow. Value-wise, it adheres to 'Safety First', sacrificing potency or trendiness to guarantee tolerance for the most vulnerable skins (babies, chemo patients).

identity.title: Sterile Expertise
identity.description: The distance between brand and user is significant; this is The Specialist speaking to a patient, not a friend. Dominated by The Caregiver (60%) and The Sage (30%), it uses a Pharma-Code visual identity (white, blue, sterile) to signal absolute competence. The tone is Clinical Authority—grave, precise, and devoid of humor.

communication.title: Functional Problem-Solving
communication.description: Messaging is stripped of poetry, focusing entirely on 'The Problem' (Irritations, Diaper Rash) and the 'Component' (Tribioma, B5). The USP is that of The Specialist—the go-to tube for specific medical crises like post-laser care. The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough, citing proprietary complexes and rigorous testing as the only story that matters.

benefits.title: Safe Restoration
benefits.description: Functionally, it is a Healer, acting as a 'bandage' for damaged skin. The Emotional payoff is Relief—the cessation of panic/pain rather than the addition of joy. Socially, it represents The Safe Choice, offering the user the pragmatic comfort of a product that 'just works' and is endorsed by the medical establishment.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is derived entirely from the white coat—'Dermatologist-tested', 'Accepted by National Eczema Association', and proprietary 'Tribioma' complex signal medical validation (Source: 2/5 Derm-Validated). The mission is not to make you look pretty, but to fix what is broken—'Soothing therapeutic balm', 'Dry skin irritations', 'Diaper rash' targets repair and recovery (Goal: 2/5 Restoration). Medical authority + damage repair = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: Soothing therapeutic balm for dry skin irritations... Dermatologist-tested... Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Tribioma... prevent diaper rash

marker_2.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on specific pathologies—'Diaper rash', 'Post-procedure', 'Chemotherapy' use cases are about micro-correction of specific issues (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). However, the access is high—this is a 'Multi-use balm' available via subscription and standard retail channels, bringing hospital-grade care to the home (Access: 4/5 Approachable). Accessible medical correction = The Democratizers of dermatology.
marker_2.evidence: Diaper rash... Post-procedure... Suitable during chemotherapy... Multi-use balm... Subscription offer

marker_3.reasoning: Performance is defined by what it *doesn't* do (irritate)—'Suitable for babies 1 week+', 'Do not use on broken skin', 'Tested with non-ablative laser' prioritize absolute tolerance over aggressive activity (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is evidence-based—citing 'Tribioma', 'Prebiotic complex', and specific medical use cases (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First). Tolerance focus + medical evidence = Safety First.
marker_3.evidence: Suitable for babies 1 week+... Tested with non-ablative laser... Do not use on broken skin... Tribioma... Prebiotic complex

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is purposefully austere—'Clean Dermatological', 'Clinical white', 'Pharmaceutical blue' create a sterile, zero-emotion environment (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The pricing and distribution place it in the Masstige tier—premium pharmacy, not luxury boutique (Value: 3/5 Masstige). Sterile look + pharmacy placement = The Medical Authority.
marker_4.evidence: Clinical white background... Pharmaceutical blue... Purposeful austerity... Clean Dermatological aesthetic

marker_5.reasoning: The emotional temperature is professional and distant—'Therapeutic', 'Protectant', 'Formulated with' are words of a clinician, not a friend (Thermostat: 2/5 Distant). The power dynamic is authoritative—warnings like 'Do not use on broken skin' and certifications like 'Accepted by NEA' establish the brand as The Specialist instructing the patient (Power Dynamic: 4/5 Specialist). Professional distance + authority = The Reliable Expert.
marker_5.evidence: Therapeutic... Protectant... Formulated with... Do not use on broken skin... Accepted by the National Eczema Association

marker_6.reasoning: The dominant drive is to protect and heal the vulnerable—'Babies', 'Chemotherapy', 'Diaper Rash' signals The Caregiver (60%). This is supported by The Sage (30%), who brings the 'Tribioma' science and 'Dermatologist' truth to the caregiving. A hint of The Ruler (10%) appears in the 'Accepted' stamps and strict usage guidelines. Primary Caregiver (Group A) = The Stabilizers, offering certainty and protection in a chaotic world.
marker_6.evidence: Suitable for babies... Chemotherapy... Diaper rash... Tribioma... Dermatologist-tested... Accepted by NEA

marker_7.reasoning: The tone is completely devoid of humor or excitement—'Therapeutic balm', 'Post-procedure', 'Do not use' are grave, clinical terms (Humor/Enthusiasm: 1/5). The dress code is Traditional ('Formulated with'), utilizing passive voice and medical terminology (Formality: 2/5). Low Warmth + Low Energy = The Clinical Authority, building trust through absolute seriousness.
marker_7.evidence: Therapeutic balm... Post-procedure... Do not use on broken skin... Formulated with Tribioma... Suitable for all ages

marker_8.reasoning: The visual temperature is hospital-grade cold—stark white backgrounds with 'pharmaceutical blue' accents signal sterility and safety (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid and structured, using a standard two-column e-commerce grid that prioritizes information hierarchy over expression (Entropy: 2/5 Structured). Clinical colors + rigid structure = Pharma-Code.
marker_8.evidence: Clinical white background... Pharmaceutical blue... Two-column layout... Stark contrast... Medical-style dropshadowing
marker_8.look_and_feel: This is purposeful austerity — a 'Clean Dermatological' aesthetic framed in cold white with thin injections of pharmaceutical blue.
marker_8.distinctive_asset_1: Tall, narrow semi-condensed sans-serif with minimal flair
marker_8.distinctive_asset_2: Diagonal blue chip on product tube
marker_8.distinctive_asset_4: Graphical overlay showing hand applying thick cream
marker_8.primary_palette: They coat everything in clinical white to build medical credibility, pulsed with sterile sky blue to accentuate precision.

marker_9.reasoning: The hook centers on the components ('B5', 'Tribioma') and the specific therapeutic function ('Soothing therapeutic balm') rather than a lifestyle dream (Hook: 2/5 Component). The persuasion is purely Rational, connecting specific causes (Prebiotic complex) to specific effects (Support microbiome, protect skin) without emotional fluff (Persuasion: 2/5 Rational). Functional hook + logic = The Problem Solver.
marker_9.evidence: Cicaplast Balm B5+... Tribioma... Soothing therapeutic balm... Support skin microbiome... Protects from drying effects

marker_10.reasoning: The protagonist is the faceless collective of 'Dermatologists' and the brand's research entity, not a specific founder (Protagonist: 1/5 The Nobel). The setting is the clinic or lab, where 'Proprietary complexes' like Tribioma are formulated and 'Laser tests' are conducted (Setting: 1/5 Sterile). Faceless authority + clinical setting = The Lab Breakthrough.
marker_10.evidence: Dermatologist-tested... Formulated with Tribioma... Proprietary prebiotic complex... Tested with non-ablative laser

marker_11.reasoning: Validation comes directly from the top of the medical hierarchy—'Dermatologist-tested', 'National Eczema Association' (Validator: 1/5 The Board). Proof is based on clinical stress-tests—'Tested with non-ablative laser', 'Suitable during chemotherapy' are rigorous clinical scenarios, not lifestyle attributes (Proof: 1/5 The Graph/Clinical). Medical endorsement + clinical testing = Derm-Validation.
marker_11.evidence: Dermatologist-tested... Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Tested with non-ablative laser... Suitable during chemotherapy

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: They own the proprietary 'Tribioma' complex and the 'B5' formulation (Ownership: 3/5 Complex). The scope is highly specific—it's not just a lotion; it's a tool for 'Dry skin irritations', 'Diaper rash', and 'Post-procedure' care (Scope: 4/5 The Problem). Proprietary complex + specific medical problem = The Specialist.
marker_12.evidence: Tribioma... proprietary prebiotic complex... Cicaplast... Dry skin irritations... Post-procedure... Diaper rash

marker_13.reasoning: The content focuses on explaining the mechanism ('Prebiotic complex', 'Microbiome') and proper usage ('How to apply', 'Where to apply') (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to prove safety and efficacy through 'Accepted' seals and testing claims, establishing a thesis of medical reliability (Intent: 1/5 Thesis). Education + Proof = Science Education.
marker_13.evidence: Formulated with Tribioma... How to apply... Accepted by NEA... Tested with non-ablative laser... Balance and support skin microbiome

marker_14.reasoning: The mechanism is active healing—'Therapeutic balm', 'Seal out wetness', 'Prevent diaper rash' acts as a bandage to repair the barrier (Action: 4/5 Healer). The outcome is biological health—'Balance and support skin microbiome', 'Hydrates cracked skin' targets the physiological state, not the cosmetic look (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). Repair + Biology = Restoration.
marker_14.evidence: Therapeutic balm... Seal out wetness... Prevent diaper rash... Balance and support skin microbiome... Hydrates cracked skin

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: The product addresses high-anxiety situations—'Diaper rash' (screaming baby), 'Chemotherapy' (health crisis), 'Irritations' (pain). It offers the removal of this panic (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is internal Sanctuary—knowing you and your family are safe and protected (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary). Crisis relief + safety = Relief/Safety.
marker_15.evidence: Diaper rash... Chemotherapy... Radiation... Irritations... Cracked skin... Soothing

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: This is a utilitarian purchase. You buy it because it works on 'diaper rash' or 'cracked skin', not to express your identity (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). It functions as The Standard—a staple product found in many homes and drugstores, widely accepted as the default 'repair' cream (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard). Utility + Mass Standard = The Pragmatist.
marker_16.evidence: Multi-use balm... Diaper rash... Cracked skin... 100 mL tube... Subscription offer

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Acceptance (I want to be accepted by the group)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is safety and acceptance—using a product 'Accepted by NEA' and 'Dermatologist-tested' ensures you are making the responsible choice for your family (Social Vector: 2/5 Acceptance). The tribe is the mainstream majority who trust medical advice (Group Dynamic: 1/5 The Majority). Safety seeking + Majority trust = The Safe Choice.
marker_17.evidence: Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Dermatologist-tested... Suitable for all ages... Adults, children, babies
